text: Claros is a Spanish language topographic name, which is derived from claro, meaning a "clearing in a forest".Dictionary of American Family Names. "Claros Family History", Oxford University Press, 2013. Retrieved on 21 January 2016. The name may refer to: *Domingo José Claros Pérez de Guzmán, 13th Duke of Medina Sidonia (1691–1739) *Jorge Claros (born 1986), Honduran football player *Josep Clarós (born 1969), Spanish basketball coach *Juan Claros Pérez de Guzmán, 11th Duke of Medina Sidonia (1642–1713) ==Other uses== *Claros, Greece *Montes Claros, Brazil ==References== Category:Spanish-language surnames
title: Claros (surname)
